topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
You know science fiction often times talks about aliens, time travel, parallel universes and such as though they're trivial, but thinking on things if such things were to actually happen to you do you think you could emotionally and psychologically handle it?

Hypothetically if say by some freak accident multiple *exact* copies of you from a parallel universe, that are so similar that you could spend all of your lives trying to find any difference to the point you're not sure who is from the parallel universe and who isn't, were to pop in your bedroom would you be able to psychologically handle it?

Hypothetically if say a version of you from the future by some freak accident were to pop into your room would you be able to psychologically handle it?

Psychologically speaking would you be able to handle the realization that there's potentially millions of exact copies of yourself and that you in no shape or form will be unique or different?  How would you react psychologically if there were multiple copies of you?


Let's dial down the scifi a bit and talk about mass production humans.  With how 3d printing is looking at creating artificial organs there's the risk of potentially entire humans being copied or intentionally done so.  If you were copied could you handle the idea that you might not be the original?
Side note: personally I think eventually mass production humans might become true as a means of the super rich believing that they can gain immortality from it; this you dies just replace him; that you dies just replace him.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: Does anyone know a good place to watch the Evangelion dub? (Those DVDs are expensive)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b5f8826368721292bc0900#post_54b5f8826368721292bc0900

Personally speakin, yeah, I would be hyped cause I would get to know what happened after I didn't went a certain way. Just hearing the ways things change even if minor is so fascinating to find out, and what better way than with myself.

Though I would have a hard time trying not to punch myself after hearing my voice for a period of time
